abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the  Urban Transport Sector
            Development Policy Loan Project for Morocco were as follows:
            outcome was moderately unsatisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: (i) for
            Development Policy Loan (DPLs) to achieve results, the broad
            and early participation of implementing agencies and local
            governments, and a strong reform momentum by the government,
            need to be in place at entry; (ii) flexible and adaptive
            responses by the government are required to continue
            pursuing the DPL’s objectives when specific actions do not
            achieve expected results; (iii) the Bank’s convening
            authority and intellectual leadership need to support the
            government’s work on consensus building and interagency
            coordination, especially at the initial stages of DPLs; (iv)
            the Bank has an important role to play in ensuring that all
            investment options are analyzed, with a view to selecting
            the least-cost options; and (v) sector DPLs could be more
            effective if accompanied by parallel investment lending and
            technical assistance, or designed as a programmatic series
            that would expand the implementation time frame to several years.
